title: The role of laboratory  experiments in HCI: help, hindrance, or ho-hum?
proctitle: CHI '89: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: C. G. Wolf
authors.institution: IBM Watson Research Center, Yorktown Heights, NY

authors.name: J. M. Carroll
authors.institution: IBM Watson Research Center, Yorktown Heights, NY

references.text: Egan, D. E., Gomez, L. M., McKeown, K., Soloway, E., Reiser, B., and Marshall, C. Panel: Dealing with diversity: Approaches to individual differences in human-computer interaction. CHI "88 Conference Proceedings, pages 79-81, 1988.

Gould, J. D., Boles, S. J., Levy, S., Richards, J. T., and Schoonard, J. The 1984 Olympic Message System: A test of behavioral principles of system design. Communications of the ACM, 30:758-769, 1987.
Karat, J. Evaluating user interface complexity. Proceedings of the Human Factors Society 31st Annual Meeting, pages 566-570, 1987.
Newell, A. and Card, S. K. The prospects for psychological science in human-computer interaction. Human-Computer Interaction, 1:209-242, 1985.

Rhyne, J. R. and Wolf, C. G. Gestural interfaces for information processing applications. Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Human-Computer interaction, 1987. Also IBM Research Report RC 12179, 1986.

Whiteside, J., Bennett, J., and Holtzblatt, K. Usability engineering: Our experience and evolution, in Helander, M., editor, Handbook of Human-Computer Interaction, pages 791-817., Elsevier, Amsterdam, 1988.
